CatDescriptText: Article accompanying related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 29, 1957, pg. A13, reads: "Watts - Carr Wedding Held in Central - Central Baptist Church was the setting for the marriage of Miss Martha Ann Watts, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Watts, to Clarence H. Carr, during the month of brides. The Rev. Cornell E. Talley officiated.  The groom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Baker Carr.  The bride's gown of ivory pure silk satin, appliqued in Chantilly lace was created along princess lines.  Her bouquet was of white orchids and roses.  Wearing pastel nylon net gowns were Mrs. Edward Rose, matron of honor; Mrs. Sandra Taylor, Misses Earline and Dorothy Tibbs, Mrs. Allease Hayes, Miss Katherine Campbell and Miss Ine Snowden, bridesmaids.  Christine Guy was flower girl and Glen Lenell Donald was ring bearer.  Best man was Duane Hampton.  Charles Hill, Walter Valentine, William Harper, Edward Rose, Harry Durham, Leo Willingham and Oliver Suddeth were ushers.  Out-of-town guest included the bride's aunt Miss Sally Shinn, Mr. and Mrs. R. C. Moore, all from Concord, N. C.; Miss Odessa Shinn, Mr. and Mrs. Zackery Hobbs, Philadelphia; Mr. and Mrs. Alfred Johnson, Youngstown, Ohio; William Qualls, Baltimore, Md.; R. Spady, Philadelphia, and Mrs. Delores Duncan, sister of the groom, Chicago.  The Warren Catering Co. was in charge of the reception held in Union Hall."
TitMainTitle: Groom Clarence H. Carr wearing tuxedo with tails, and bride Martha Ann Watts Carr wearing floral jacquard gown with buttoned front and holding bouquet, posed in Central Baptist Church
